channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: U.S.-backed food distribution plan is a 'weaponization of aid' in Gaza, UN says
item.description: The new rollout of Israel's U.S.-backed food distribution plan has been greatly flawed and stirring chaos and desperation in Gaza.

item.title: A gazillionaire becomes conflicted in Wes Anderson's 'The Phoenician Scheme'
item.description: Wes Anderson's latest comedy The Phoenician Scheme stars Benicio del Toro, Scarlett Johansson, Michael Cera and Bill Murray.

item.title: Trump administration's vaccines announcements have many health experts alarmed
item.description: Public health experts worry the flurry of steps by the Trump administration about vaccines is undermining public access and confidence in vaccines.

item.title: Supreme Court limits environmental reviews of infrastructure projects
item.description: The decision makes it easier to win approval for highways, bridges, pipelines, wind farms, and other infrastructure projects.

item.title: The hunt for a microbial marvel that can help with the planet's biggest issues
item.description: What if the solutions to some of Earth's biggest problems could be found in some of its smallest creatures? That bet has led a team of researchers to places both remote and — lately — rather familiar.

item.title: Elon Musk has left the government. What's next for DOGE?
item.description: Elon Musk says he is leaving the federal government behind after making controversial cuts now at the center of lawsuits. But he says the work of DOGE will continue.

item.title: Officials blame climate change for glacier collapse that destroyed Swiss town
item.description: A collapsing glacier roared down a mountainside in the Swiss Alps on Wednesday. It wiped out one village in its path. The destruction it caused surprised officials who blamed climate change.

item.title: 'It girl' golfer remembered, decades after her death
item.description: She was called the IT girl of women's golf in the Great Gatsby era. Miriam Burns won the 1927 Women's Amateur championship. She retired fromcompetitive golf in 1930 when she was 26, died at 47 and was laid to rest in an unmarked Kansas city grave. That all changes on May 30th when a headstone will be placed on her grave during a memorial service that will include golf great Tom Watson and family members of Burns only grandson

item.title: This week in science: hawks hunting, infrared contacts and immunity through the day
item.description: Berly McCoy and Regina Barber of Short Wave talk about a hawk's clever hunting strategy, contacts that allow wearers to see infrared light, and how immunity varies during the day.

item.title: In Oregon, two birds of a different feather flock together
item.description: In Portland, Ore., two distinct species of geese have paired up and laid eggs. It's not completely unheard of for a Canada goose and a white-fronted goose to mate -- but it's unusual.
